Malware is software that is designed to damage or disable computers and computer systems. Malware includes viruses, worms, Trojan horses, spyware, ransomware and adware.

### Viruses

A virus is a piece of code that replicates itself and spreads from one computer to another. It may do this by attaching itself to an email message or by hiding in a document, such as a Word file. Once a virus has infected a computer, it can cause damage to the system, such as corrupting files or deleting data.

A worm is a type of malware that spreads from one computer to another over a network. Unlike a virus, a worm does not need to attach itself to a file or program. Instead, it spreads by exploiting security vulnerabilities in the network. Once a worm has infected a computer, it can cause damage by consuming system resources, such as bandwidth and CPU cycles.
